Mike_Ryan_(musician):
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}}

'''Mike Ryan''' is a [[country music|country]] singer, songwriter, and guitarist from [[San Antonio]], Texas.<ref name="rs">{{cite web | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/premieres/hear-mike-ryans-clever-breakup-song-new-hometown-w445642 | title=Hear Mike Ryan's Clever Breakup Song 'New Hometown' | publisher=Rolling Stone | date=19 October 2016 | accessdate=21 April 2017}}</ref><ref name="wt">{{cite web | url=http://www.wacotrib.com/entertainment/accesswaco/music/texas-singer-songwriter-mike-ryan-finds-experience-the-best-teacher/article_d1e60f8f-1e66-5e02-8acb-a32979615808.html | title=Texas singer-songwriter Mike Ryan finds experience the best teacher | publisher=Waco Tribune | date=11 June 2015 | accessdate=21 April 2017}}</ref> He has released two studio albums and one EP.

Ryan was born in 1988,<ref name="am">{{cite web | url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/mike-ryan-mn0002966146/biography | title=Artist Biography by Mark Deming | publisher=Allmusic | accessdate=21 April 2017}}</ref> and attended the [[University of North Texas]], where he began performing publicly.<ref name="pbs">{{cite web | url=http://www.panhandlepbs.org/blogs/play-here/mike-ryan-hopes-to-live-up-to-reputation/ | title=Mike Ryan hopes to live up to 'Reputation' | publisher=Panhandle PBS | date=20 April 2016 | accessdate=21 April 2017}}</ref> After touring regionally, he released an EP, ''The First One'', in 2010, and his debut studio album, ''Night Comes Falling'', in 2012.<ref name="am"/>  He then signed a publishing contract with [[Sea Gayle Music]], and released his second studio album, ''Bad Reputation'', in 2014.<ref name="pbs"/> Three songs from ''Bad Reputation''—"Dancing All Around It," "Wasting No More Whiskey," and "Bad Reputation"—reached number one on the Texas country music chart, and Ryan was named New Male Vocalist of the Year in 2015 by industry association Texas Regional Radio.<ref name="pbs"/>  He released "New Hometown," the lead single from his third studio album, in October 2016.<ref name="rs"/> In 2017, he released his third studio album, ''Blink You'll Miss It''. In 2021, his single, ''Can Down'' reached number five on the Texas country music chart.
